result.execSummary:
The defendant Reno Lee Torgerson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes:
Def to report to the DOC in Ashland the first day after release from the Ashland County Jail!
If def is placed on probation or extended supervision & owes financial obligations ordered by the Court at the time of discharge, a civil judgment may be entered against the def for all unpaid financial obligations.
  While on supervision the Def is to pay their financial obligations thru the Clerk of Court, which may include payments on restitution, fines, costs, surcharges, etc that are court ordered.
The payments are to be paid directly to the Clerk of Court Office at:
Ashland Co Clerk of Circuit Court
201 Main Street West - Room 307
Ashland, WI  54806

miscConds.notes: All financial obligations placed on payment plan $25 per month beginning 10/19/16
Seek and obtain employment, maintain at least half time employement or half time schooling

The Def, being found guilty of a felony or other crime specified in sub.(1) under WI statutes Sect. 941.29 under the WI Criminal Code of requirements and penalties.
   " A person subject to the requirements and penalties is prohibited from possessing, receiving,
     obtaining a firearm/body armor." 

NOTE:  Under WI State Statute 6.03(1)(b) a person found guilty of a felony that you are ineligible to vote in any election until your civil rights are restored!

Def is to undergo counseling for criminal thinking through a Cognitive-Thinking for Change therapy program.
  The Def is to obtain counseling as directed by DOC at the expense of the Def.

NO CONTACT WITH GARY BEEKSMA
NO CONTACT WITH MARIA EVEY
NO CONTACT WITH MISTY WHITE
NO CONTACT WITH RAQUEL TORGERSON
No possession of dangerous weapons
  Defendant shall not possess/consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs, drug paraphernalia or any mind altering substances (MAS).  MAS means alcoholic beverages, controlled substances other than those prescribed by treating physician to the Def & taken only as prescribed, inhalants, synthetic marijuana or a similar substance, and/or over-the-counter medications used contrary to label instructions.  THE DEFENDANT IS TO MAINTAIN ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
The Defendant shall not enter any bars, taverns, liquor stores (any place where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol) where mind altering substances are present, consumed or sold..
  The Def is subject to random UA testing.
  The Def is to provide a DNA specimen to the Ashland County Jail
Undergo alcohol/drug assessment and complete recommended treatment-responsible for finding the funding for any treatment/counseling recommended.

Granted Work and Child Care Release

Defendant Reno Lee Torgerson in court with attorney Daniel Francis Snyder.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 16CF34 and 16CF166, ADA parties have reached agreement detailed in offer to settle. Def pleads NC to 2 counts. Ct 4 16CF34 DRI. Ct accepts plea and found guilty.
State has complied with victim rights. Attornies comments on sentencing.
Sentencing as agreed upon.

Attorney Daniel Francis Snyder in court for Defendant Reno Lee Torgerson. Prosecuting Atty Ruth Kressel appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Reno Lee Torgerson appeared by video means. Rec copy of compl 16CF166, waives reading, waives time limits for prelim. Atty believes parties close to resolution. STC both cases  Status conference scheduled for August 19, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Perrine no other questiones. DA re-questiones. No recross. No other evidence. DA closing arugments. No arugment by defense atty's.  Court finds prob cause for each defendant and case that felonys were committed in Ashland CO. bound over for argnment. Both Defense atty's will proceed. INFO filed. Misty white stands mute waives reading. Not guilty entered for her. Reno torgerson stands mute, plea of not guilty entered for each count. waives reading. STC with both parties on all cases July 26 @ 10am  DA will file motion soon on both cases. Reno Torgerson requested TAD assessment. Court now finds he is not eligable for TAD assessment, Will not have TAD assessment.  Status conference scheduled for July 26, 2016 at 10:00 am.
